page.title: 03Farming South Yorkshire
page.content: In the area there are eight{farms}. Most of the{farms}are very old.Most of the{farming}is arable,but there is a sheep farm in Brodsworth ,mangels are grown to feed the sheep.At{harvest time the work is done by machine.The{ {crops} are mainly rape,wheat,barley and potatoes.Hill Farm hires potato pickers.In Spring cereal factories go to the{farms}in the area to buy the {crops}from last years{harvest}.Each farm has about five farmworkers .Soft fruit is grown at Marr for people to pick.Every so often one of the farmers hires a biplane or helicopter to spray the{crops}.This is done to kill insects or blight.Also at{harvest}, lorries are hired to take the grain to the silos. After the corn has been cut the straw is bailed by a firm or it is burnt.It does not take long to bail because it is done by a big bailer.
